etymology.description: 兵(兵) (bīng, "soldier; military") + 法(法) (fǎ, "method; law") = "military method; art of war". The term 兵法(兵法) (bīngfǎ, "art of war") refers to strategies and tactics used in warfare and is famously associated with 孙子兵法(孫子兵法) (Sūnzǐ Bīngfǎ, "Sun Tzu's Art of War"), an ancient Chinese military treatise.
etymology.interpretation: 兵法(兵法) (bīngfǎ, "art of war") combines 兵(兵) (bīng, "soldier; military") and 法(法) (fǎ, "method; law") to describe the strategic and tactical doctrines used in warfare, particularly influenced by the teachings of Sun Tzu. It highlights the importance of understanding and implementing military strategies effectively.

examples.chinese: 他研习兵法(他研習兵法)，探索战争策略(探索戰爭策略)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yánxí bīngfǎ, tànsuǒ zhànzhēng cèlüè.
examples.english: He studies military art and explores war strategies.

examples.chinese: 古代兵法影响深远(古代兵法影響深遠)。
examples.english: Ancient military art has a profound influence.

examples.chinese: 諸葛亮精通兵法(諸葛亮精通兵法)，指挥军队如运筹帷幄(指揮軍隊如運籌帷幄)。
examples.pinyin: Zhūgě Liàng jīngtōng bīngfǎ, zhǐhuī jūnduì rú yùnchóu wéiwò.
examples.english: Zhuge Liang was adept in military art and led his troops with brilliant strategy.
